TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IResourceUrlGenerator

Docs.summary: Defines the method that a designer-host must implement to provide URL reference look-up for embedded resources.

remarks.format:
## Remarks ASP.NET version 2.0 provides the ability to retrieve embedded resources from an assembly for controls, such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> control. At run time, the URL to the embedded resource can be retrieved using the <xref:System.Web.UI.ClientScriptManager.GetWebResourceUrl%2A> method of the <xref:System.Web.UI.ClientScriptManager> class. To provide a design-time means for generating a resource URL from an assembly, designer hosts can offer a service that implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.IResourceUrlGenerator> interface. For more information:
- On using resources in localization, see [ASP.NET Web Page Resources Overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/0936b3b2-9e6e-4abe-9c06-364efef9dbbd).
- On using embedded resources, see [How to: Use Resources to Set Property Values in Web Server Controls](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/dotnet/netframework-3.0/ms228093(v=vs.85)) and [How to: Retrieve Resource Values Programmatically](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/ms227982(v=vs.140)).
- On control designers, see [ASP.NET Control Designers Overview](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/aspnet/wxh45wzs(v=vs.100)).
The <xref:System.Web.UI.IResourceUrlGenerator> interface has one method, the <xref:System.Web.UI.IResourceUrlGenerator.GetResourceUrl%2A> method, that returns a URL reference to a resource given the resource type and name.

MemberSignature.Value: public string GetResourceUrl (Type type, string resourceName);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetResourceUrl(class System.Type type, string resourceName) cil managed
Public Function GetResourceUrl (type As Type, resourceName As String) As String
public: System::String ^ GetResourceUrl(Type ^ type, System::String ^ resourceName);
abstract member GetResourceUrl : Type * string -> string

Docs.param: The type in the assembly that contains the embedded resource.
The name of the resource to retrieve.
Docs.summary: Returns a URL reference to an embedded resource in an assembly that is used at design time.
Docs.returns: The URL reference to the resource.

remarks.format:
## Remarks At run time, the <xref:System.Web.UI.ClientScriptManager.GetWebResourceUrl%2A> method returns a URL to a resource. The <xref:System.Web.Handlers.AssemblyResourceLoader> class defines the HTTP handler that is used to load embedded resources.
At design time, the <xref:System.Web.UI.ClientScriptManager.GetWebResourceUrl%2A> method of the <xref:System.Web.UI.ClientScriptManager> class detects design mode and delegates to the designer-host service implementation, which returns a URL.
